FuncDef: The network command sets a network segment address for a global address pool. The undo network command restores the default network segment address. By default, no network segment address is specified.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a network segment address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation, and must be class A, B, or C IP addresses.

Indicates the mask of a network segment address for a global address pool. If this parameter is not configured, a natural mask is used.
-

Specifies the mask of a network segment address for a global address pool.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a network mask length.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 32, excluding 0-7, 31, and 32.

ExtraInfo: This command applies to DHCP servers. Before a DHCP server assigns IP addresses to clients from a global address pool, run the network command to set a network segment address for the global address pool so that the DHCP server can select and assign IP addresses on this network segment to clients. When a DHCP server assigns an IP address to the client from the interface address pool, the network segment of the interface IP address is that of the interface address pool.
